choices: We have a large set of news articles about economic topics. In a given article, we want to look at quantities and figures being reported and identify the type of figure (i.e. macro-economic, industry-specific, firm-specific, personal story), and in case of a macroeconomic, industry or government figure, identify the specific sub-type/indicator being discussed. You will be presented with an excerpt from an article:
1. A quantity will be highlighted in yellow
2. If the quantity is a date or otherwise not relevant, label it as Not Relevant and continue to the next excerpt.
4. data points may not fit into one of the groups. These should be labeled Other
